conclusion: Analyze motion using v-t graph to determine collision.
Car travels at 30 m/s, truck at 10 m/s, car 30 meters behind.
Car's velocity decreases from 30 m/s to 10 m/s over 4 seconds.
Calculate distance traveled by car from t=0s to t=1s as 30 m.
Calculate average velocity of car from t=1s to t=5s as 20 m/s.
Calculate distance traveled by car from t=1s to t=5s as 80 m.
Total distance traveled by car from t=0s to t=5s is 110 m.
Calculate distance traveled by truck as 50 m.
Determine relative position: car covers 30 m more than truck plus initial gap.
Car will catch up to truck and collide.
Final answer: Yes, the two cars will collide.
